availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry M. Garton (Trigg County, Kentucky, dentist.)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, dentist. Christian County, Kentucky, native. Son of James Clark Garton and Frances W. Garton. Married to Ellen Cornelia Harpending Kuykendoll Garton. Father of Henry H. Garton. Stepfather of Margaret Kuykendoll. Saddler in Christian County, Kentucky, in 1850. Dentist in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 1, p. 433A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, pp. 187-8.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 391A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 49A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994056, Trigg County Births, p. 945.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bracken County Marriages, Film 000851644.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 20167.
"Henry M. Garton," The Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), July 3, 1913, p. 4.
